Interface GUIInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GUI

    public interface GUIInterface
    Author:
    Nelphindal

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  GUIInterface.Button
      Basic buttons for the GUI

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Sets this GUI invisible and frees all allocated resources.
      void endProgress()
      Ends current progress
      void getOptions(java.util.Collection<Option> options)
      Displays the given options and allows to modify them
      GUIInterface.Button getPressedButton() 
      java.awt.Component getProgressBar() 
      void initProgress()
      Initializes all componets allowing to display a progress
      void printErrorMessage(java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Like printMessage(String, String, boolean) but needs always confirmation and different colors will be used to indicate an error.
      void printMessage(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String message, boolean bringGUItoFront)
      Prints a message.
      void runPlugin(GUIPlugin plugin)
      Displays a no default GUI operation with given plugin.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> selectModules(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> modules)
      Basic GUI operation to determine the modules to be run.
      void setProgress(int progress)
      Sets the progress.
      void setProgressSize(int size)
      Sets the progresses maximum size.
      void setProgressSize(int size, java.lang.String title)
      Works like combined setProgressTitle(String) and setProgressSize(int).
      void setProgressTitle(java.lang.String title)
      Sets the title to be shown during running progress.

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Sets this GUI invisible and frees all allocated resources. All further invocations are undefined

      • endProgress

        void endProgress()
        Ends current progress

        Displays the given options and allows to modify them

        GUIInterface.Button getPressedButton()
        Returns:
        the last pressed button.

        java.awt.Component getProgressBar()
        Returns:
        a component to display a progress-bar

      • initProgress

        void initProgress()
        Initializes all componets allowing to display a progress

      • printErrorMessage

        void printErrorMessage(java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Like printMessage(String, String, boolean) but needs always confirmation and different colors will be used to indicate an error.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage -
        See Also:
        printMessage(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, boolean)

      • printMessage

        void printMessage(java.lang.String title,
                  java.lang.String message,
                  boolean bringGUItoFront)
        Prints a message. It will block if toFront is true as long the user does not confirm the message.
        Parameters:
        title -
        message - the message
        bringGUItoFront - user has have to confirm the message

      • runPlugin

        void runPlugin(GUIPlugin plugin)
        Displays a no default GUI operation with given plugin.
        Parameters:
        plugin -

      • selectModules

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> selectModules(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> modules)
        Basic GUI operation to determine the modules to be run.
        Parameters:
        modules -
        Returns:
        a set containing the selected modules.

      • setProgress

        void setProgress(int progress)
        Sets the progress.
        Parameters:
        progress - the new state of the progress

      • setProgressSize

        void setProgressSize(int size)
        Sets the progresses maximum size.
        Parameters:
        size - the new maximum size

      • setProgressSize

        void setProgressSize(int size,
                     java.lang.String title)
        Works like combined setProgressTitle(String) and setProgressSize(int). initProgress() will be called as needed.
        Parameters:
        size -
        title -

      • setProgressTitle

        void setProgressTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title to be shown during running progress.
        Parameters:
        title -
